intro: Humularia kapiriensis var. kapiriensis, commonly known as the Kapiriensis humularia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understory of dense forest canopies. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires protection to ensure its survival.
